revised_title: Relaxation Techniques for Engineering Problems: Quasi-Plane-Potential Equation
tldr: This article discusses the relaxation methods applied to engineering problems, specifically those governed by the 'quasi-plane-potential equation'. The authors review the current state of relaxational techniques and explore their applications in various fields, including electricity, magnetism, and thermal conductivity. They also present the finite-difference approximation and relaxation patterns for solving these equations.
